hero.headline: Simple, Smart, Reliable Solar for Every Day
hero.sub: Since 2014, OOJED has been supplying, installing and caring for solar water heaters, rooftop solar power systems, and solar LED street/flood lights with in-house spares and BOS fabrication across Maharashtra and Goa.

mission: To help Indian homes and businesses cut their energy bills with simple, smart and reliable solar solutions, blending practical engineering with warm, dependable service so every site moves closer to a near-zero energy footprint.
about:
OOJED is an end-to-end clean energy partner for homes and businesses across Maharashtra and Goa. Since 2014, our team has been supplying, installing and maintaining solar water heaters, rooftop and hybrid solar power plants, solar pumps and solar LED street/flood lighting. Factory-tested assemblies, carefully matched BOS and in-house fabrication keep installations neat, safe and on schedule. Local crews understand hard water, grid instability and tricky roofs, and design around them with durable tanks, surge-protected drivers and dependable panels and inverters.

From the first call to long-term upkeep, we stay with you. Design, permits, procurement, commissioning, documentation and net-metering are all handled so your system performs consistently, season after season. Expect clear, itemised proposals, honest guidance on subsidies and responsive after-sales service. Ask for a site visit and we will share a practical, budget-conscious quote tailored to your location, usage and roof.

faq.q: Will it work in winter or monsoon?
faq.a: Yes. We size systems for the local climate so even on cloudy days, insulated storage ensures usable hot water.

faq.q: Is hard water a problem?
faq.a: Polymer-coated tanks and the right fittings help resist scale. An annual flush keeps efficiency high.

faq.q: How long does installation take?
faq.a: Most standard systems are installed within 4–6 hours after survey confirmation, subject to site readiness.

faq.q: What roof types are supported?
faq.a: We support RCC and metal roofs; the mounting structure is selected after the free site survey.

faq.q: How do you decide capacity (LPD)?
faq.a: We look at occupants, bathing style, plumbing pressure and bathrooms to suggest 100–500 LPD with a comfortable margin for winter.

faq.q: Is subsidy available in my city?

categories.long: We design and deliver rooftop and ground-mounted solar power plants that match your actual consumption pattern and site conditions. Every project starts with detailed shadow analysis, yield estimates and a transparent proposal. Smart monitoring for generation, performance and alerts

faq.q: Will my electricity bill become zero?
faq.a: Actual savings depend on system size, policy and usage. Most customers see 70–90% reduction with properly sized systems and net-metering.

faq.q: Do I need batteries?
faq.a: For bill savings, on-grid systems are usually enough. Choose a hybrid system if you also want backup during power cuts.

faq.q: Will my roof be drilled?
faq.a: We use non-penetrative or sealed mounts depending on your roof type and wind zone, with a focus on leak-free installation.

cta.helper: Upload the last 6 months of electricity bills for accurate sizing and payback calculation.

categories.name: Solar Pumps
categories.desc: DC (1–21 HP) and AC (1–100 HP) solar pumps sized for required head and flow, with MNRE-compliant protections for fields, farms and industry.
categories.metaTitle: Solar Water Pumps {{city}}, Maharashtra — Sizing, Installation, AMC | OOJED
categories.metaDescription: Solar water pumps in {{city}} — accurate sizing for head and flow, MPPT/VFD controllers, dry-run protection and installation with AMC options for farms, borewells and industrial users.
categories.long: Our solar pumping systems are engineered around your water requirement rather than a generic HP rating. MPPT or VFD-based controllers, suitable mounting and protection kits deliver reliable water for irrigation, livestock and remote locations. Each system is sized for the required head and flow, checked against your bore and pipeline data, and protected with dry-run, over-voltage and surge safeguards. The result is steady, predictable water delivery with low running cost.
highlights: Sized to actual head and flow required at your farm or plant
MPPT/VFD controllers for efficient pumping in varying light
Dry-run, over-voltage and surge protection as standard design
Galvanised structures with civil and foundation drawings
Optional remote monitoring for high-value installations

quickSpecs.Head: Designed up to your site requirement (validated during survey)
quickSpecs.Flow: Matched to agronomic or industrial demand
quickSpecs.Autonomy: Optimised for seasonal solar profile and water schedule

faq.q: Can it run in low light?
faq.a: Smart controllers maximise available sunlight, but for monsoon-heavy regions we often oversize the array or plan storage to keep output practical.

faq.q: Will it work with my existing bore?
faq.a: Yes, provided the bore diameter, depth and water level match an appropriate pump curve. We verify this during sizing.

faq.q: How do you size head and flow?
faq.a: We consider static and dynamic water levels, required discharge, pipe friction and elevation before finalising pump HP and controller capacity.

faq.q: AC vs DC pump — what should I choose?
faq.a: DC pumps are efficient for dedicated solar systems. AC pumps with VFD are ideal when you want flexibility to run from grid or generator as well.

cta.helper: Share required head, flow, bore size and approximate running hours to get a tailored design.

services.name: Feasibility & Survey
services.short: On-site surveys, shading analysis and realistic yield estimation for your roof.
services.metaTitle: Solar Feasibility & Site Survey Pune — Shading, Yield, Payback | OOJED
services.metaDescription: On-site solar feasibility in Pune — shading analysis, orientation and tilt study, generation estimates and a practical report with sizing, payback and subsidy guidance.
services.long: Our feasibility and survey service gives you a clear picture before you invest. We check roof orientation, azimuth, tilt, shading, structural suitability and AC/DC routing options. Based on this, we model expected generation, size the system correctly and share an easy-to-understand recommendation with payback and subsidy guidance for your city and tariff. The result is a practical, low-risk proposal you can confidently move ahead with.

faqs.q: What does a feasibility survey include?
faqs.a: It includes on-site shadow study, orientation and tilt checks, structural mounting assessment, estimated generation and a short written report with recommended system size and expected payback.

faqs.q: How long does a survey take?
faqs.a: A typical residential rooftop survey takes 1–2 hours. Larger commercial or institutional sites are first screened remotely and then surveyed in a single well-planned visit when possible.
We offer free or basic surveys within {{city}} city limits. Extended travel or detailed engineering may be chargeable but is often adjusted against the final order value.

faqs.q: What if my roof has shading?
faqs.a: We measure shading, show you its impact and then suggest options like layout tweaks, selective pruning or resizing with realistic yield expectations.

highlights: On-site shading and tilt analysis with simple visuals
